intro: Mettenia globosa subsp. oblongata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mettenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its narrow, elliptical leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is often found in heathland or open woodland habitats. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 2 meters and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. The subspecies is distinguished by its elongated leaves compared to the broader leaves of the main species.
